channel.title: Distrelec Jira
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6514] Q - Registration (500 error)
item.description:
On Q in all countries you get a 500-error when opening the registration-page.

Please fix asap as this blocks testing.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: The bug is commited to the ticket DISTRELEC-6492.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6405] DB field for PIMWEBUSEA02 too small
item.description:
Some products will not be imported due to a too small DB field for the attribute PIMWEBUSEA02.
Many errors like this can be found in the console.log

item.summary: DB field for PIMWEBUSEA02 too small

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
I've implemented a new parameter in the configuration to explicitally enable the import of the DQ server informations.
The parameter is this one:

import.pim.importFactFinderDQServerInformations=true

By default the import of DQ server attributes is DISABLED.

Hi Patrick
could you please let me know the maximum length of the following fields in stibo?
It would be also interesting how these attributes are stored in Oracle database.

  • ff_search_output01_txt
  • ff_search_output02_txt
  • ff_search_output03_txt
  • ff_search_output04_txt
  • ff_search_output05_txt
  • ff_search_output06_txt
  • ff_search_output07_txt
  • ff_search_output08_txt
  • ff_search_output09_txt
  • ff_search_output10_txt
  • ff_search_output11_txt
  • ff_search_output12_txt
  • ff_filter_output01_txt
  • ff_filter_output02_txt
  • ff_filter_output03_txt
  • ff_filter_output04_txt
  • ff_filter_output05_txt
  • ff_filter_output06_txt
  • ff_filter_output07_txt
  • ff_filter_output08_txt
  • ff_filter_output09_txt
  • ff_filter_output10_txt
  • ff_filter_output11_txt
  • ff_filter_output12_txt
  • ff_search_salesRank_int

It would be also interesting how these attributes are stored in Oracle databases used by stibo.

ok i created a ticket at Stibo.
https://service.stibosystems.com/browse/DISTRE-1506

I hope it helps Patrick.
J-W

Hi J-W
I created also one:
https://service.stibosystems.com/browse/DISTRE-1505

BR, Patrick

Hi Francesco
Answer from Stibo regarding how the attributes are stored into the Oracle DB:

Hi Patrick
The Attributes are stored in node table.
The attribute values are stored in value 7 table.
If the value of the attribute is <400 bytes they are stored in value7 coloumn.
If the value of the attributes are >400 bytes they are stored in DOC coloumn.
Please let me know if you any queries regarding the same.
Regards,
Abhisek

Hope this helps you, otherwise please come back to me.

Kinds, Patrick
These attributes has been defined as CLOB
@Francesco: Please check locally whether the migration from VARCHAR to CLOB was done in the database. Otherwise you need to create some post-installation instructions. Thank you.
